comments:
3.1 RC1

I was debugging a remote application when it crashed.
The Debug view still showed me connected to the application with 4 threads.
Regardless of the command (disconnect, terminate) I attempted, I got the following:
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5010 2005-06-01 22:43:21.780
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for
packet 9502. occurred disconnecting from VM.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 9502.
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:174)
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:184)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:174)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:230)
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.VirtualMachineImpl.dispose(VirtualMachineImpl.java:572)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget.disconnect(JDIDebugTarget.java:636)
        at org.eclipse.debug.core.Launch.terminate(Launch.java:262)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.TerminateActionDelegate.doAction(TerminateActionDelegate.java:25)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.AbstractDebugActionDelegate$DebugRequestJob.run(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:106)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 5012 2005-06-01 22:43:56.280
!MESSAGE Exceptions occurred attempting to disconnect.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5010 2005-06-01 22:43:56.280
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for
packet 9503. occurred disconnecting from VM.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 9503.
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:174)
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply(PacketReceiveManager.java:184)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:174)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:230)
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.VirtualMachineImpl.dispose(VirtualMachineImpl.java:572)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget.disconnect(JDIDebugTarget.java:636)
        at org.eclipse.debug.core.Launch.disconnect(Launch.java:480)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.DisconnectActionDelegate.doAction(DisconnectActionDelegate.java:26)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.AbstractDebugActionDelegate$DebugRequestJob.run(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:106)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)


After a minute or two, the Debug view finally detected the process was dead.

This is working as expected. Looks like the front end did not receive 
a "disconnect/terminate" event, and tried to continue communication. 
Eventually the front end noticed and cleaned up.

traces.message: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 9502.
Timeout occurred while waiting for packet 9503.
